ktbyte.gui

Class TextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • ktbyte.gui.TextBox

  • public class TextBox
extends java.lang.Object
    This GUI element is a rectangle input in which text can be entered if the box is focused.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextBox(PApplet pap, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      This constructs a new TextBox object within the current context (PApplet), starting from the x and y coordinates, having the specified width and height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      This is a register method and should not be called directly
      java.lang.String getText()
      Returns the current text
      boolean isFocused()
      Returns whether the elements is focused or not
      void keyEvent(KeyEvent e)
      This is a register method and should not be called directly
      void mouseEvent(MouseEvent e)
      This is a register method and should not be called directly
      void setBorderRoundings(int r1, int r2, int r3, int r4)
      Sets the rounding of the rectangle's border.
      void setHandleFocus(boolean handleFocus)
      Sets whether the handling of the box focus will be manual or automatic.
      void setIsFocused(boolean isFocused)
      Sets the focus of the element
      void setKeyEventListener(KeyEventListener keyEventListener)
      Sets the key-event listener of the TextBox
      void setText(java.lang.String text)
      Sets the current text

      Sets the text size

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(PApplet pap,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        This constructs a new TextBox object within the current context (PApplet), starting from the x and y coordinates, having the specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        width - width of the TextBox
        height - height of the TextBox

    • Method Detail

      • setBorderRoundings

        public void setBorderRoundings(int r1,
                               int r2,
                               int r3,
                               int r4)
        Sets the rounding of the rectangle's border. The parameters should be entered in a clockwise order
        Parameters:
        r1 - Up
        r2 - Right
        r3 - Down
        r4 - Left

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This is a register method and should not be called directly

      • mouseEvent

        public void mouseEvent(MouseEvent e)
        This is a register method and should not be called directly
        Parameters:
        e - The received mouse event

      • keyEvent

        public void keyEvent(KeyEvent e)
        This is a register method and should not be called directly
        Parameters:
        e - The received key event

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        Returns whether the elements is focused or not
        Returns:
        true if the element is focused; false otherwise

      • setIsFocused

        public void setIsFocused(boolean isFocused)
        Sets the focus of the element
        Parameters:
        isFocused - true to make the element to be focused; false otherwise

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the current text
        Parameters:
        text - The text that should be displayed inside the box

      • setTextSize

        public void setTextSize(int textSize)
        Sets the text size
        Parameters:
        textSize - The text size

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the current text
        Returns:
        the current text from inside the box

      • setHandleFocus

        public void setHandleFocus(boolean handleFocus)
        Sets whether the handling of the box focus will be manual or automatic. By default the focus handling is automatic.
        Parameters:
        handleFocus - true = automatic handling, false = manual handling

      • setKeyEventListener

        public void setKeyEventListener(KeyEventListener keyEventListener)
        Sets the key-event listener of the TextBox
        Parameters:
        keyEventListener - The key-event listener
